item.description:
Successful real estate investors treat their  investments as a business.     Come hear expert Kevin Lacasse share his tips and secrets to running a multi-part real estate investing business.  

You'll learn:

  • The secret to getting the most from employees and keeping them happy
  • How to make the tough decisions
  • The best structure for ownership and management.
  • How term hold properties and flip properties work together.
  • Providing the best customer service
  • Weatherization for long term profits
  • How to conduct tenant inspections
  • Office systems for your management company
  • How to increase income without raising rents
  • How to decrease expenses
  • How to track occupancy rates
  • Tips regarding technical support systems (software, accounting systems, file sharing, communication tools)
  • How to avoid insurance pit falls
  • How to handle maintenance and turn overs
  • Tips for working with partners 
  • Tips for vendor contracts
WOW!  We can't wait! Kevin Lacasse is a former NHREIA Board member, who currently owns/manages 170 rental units made up of 54 individual properties, plus 1 waterfront campground with 90 sites/38 boats slips.  He is the sole managing member of 10 LLC's & 1 corporation, and a member of 4 additional LLC's with various partners. He currently has 13 properties in inventory for the rehab/flip side of the business and is working on a $3.5 million dollar multi-family renovation in Berlin.  He is also a licensed real estate broker and certified lead abatement contractor.

 

 

 

 

NHREIA Monthly Meeting

 6:30 PM, Wednesday, February 9, 2011

 

The Best Western Executive Court, 13500 South Willow St., Manchester Free for members; $20 for non-members
item.why: All real estate investments should be treated as a business. Come hear expert Kevin Lacasse share tips and secrets on managing a multi-part real estate investing business.
item.name: The New Hampshire Real Estate Investors Association Monthly Meetup
